title: Are there any ways to reduce ping in  League?
body: I'm sitting at 73 ms in-game and I'm located in California.  I don't plan on changing internet provider and I am using a wired internet connection.

replies.body:
Strictly speaking, no. MS (ping) is the time in milliseconds it takes for data to travel between Riot's servers and your computer, so there is no way to truly get around distances and the way data travels across the internet. There are slight things you can do to mitigate issues of ping spikes and random jitter, but you're already on a wired connection so they're likely to prove unhelpful. You can try taking a look at the [KB article to troubleshoot connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), but I'm afraid I can't promise you'll find what you're looking for.
Sorry for being unable to help you further, but if you have any more questions don't hesitate to ask! 
Regards, Kayle

I Only Kayle has provided some great insight here. The biggest factor in latency to a server is the route the ISP takes to get to that server. Our [NA Server Roadmap](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204246204-NA-Server-Roadmap) goes over a lot of the other factors in your latency and has some great visuals as well.

If you'd like to have one of our tech specialists take a look at your routing, I recommend running a set of traceroutes [using our guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) or with [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) for 5 minutes with the IP address 192.64.170.1, then exporting your results as text. Attach the traceroute with your request when you [submit a ticket.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

Let me know if you have any questions.

I might send in a traceroute but do you think i should?  I've seen streamers like C9 Sneaky who live in Santa Monica have 67 ms but I live further east of that which makes me closer to the chicago server. So, its weird that I have 73 ms.

If you'd like one of our techs to look at your route and point out any issues they see, I definitely recommend sending in a ticket with the traceroute. The traceroute will show the tech your entire route to the server and which hops along the way your connection may be experiencing issues at.
